info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 7:59PM CDT until June 25 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Mainly minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following counties, Merrick and Nance.
* WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly small creeks and rural roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 757 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated additional pockets of moderate to heavy rain passing through parts of the Advisory area. While the more concentrated heavy rain swath of 1 to 3 inches from earlier this afternoon has ended, much of the Advisory area could pick up an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain this evening and overnight. Minor flooding is likely ongoing or could still begin shortly in parts of the area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Warm Slough, Moores Creek, Silver Creek, Prairie Slough and Prairie Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Central City, Clarks, Silver Creek, Chapman and Archer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING
